snippet: A day after the United States imposed sanctions, Moscow responded with a list of Americans linked to prosecutions against Russian citizens and harsh interrogation methods.
abstract: Russian Foreign Ministry, in response to United States sanctions on Russians accused of rights violations, names 18 current and former American officials who it says are responsible for 'legalization of torture' and will now be barred from entering country.

byline.contributor: Peter Baker contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: A day after the United States imposed sanctions, Moscow responded with a list of Americans linked to prosecutions against Russian citizens and harsh interrogation methods.

headline.seo: Russia Bars 18 Americans After Sanctions by U.S.
headline.main: Russia Bars 18 Americans After Sanctions by U.S.
headline.print_headline: Russia Bars 18 Americans After Sanctions by U.S.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
